title: Understanding Population Sampling
text: Population sampling is a crucial step in research. It involves selecting a group of individuals from a larger population to participate in a study. This process helps researchers make inferences about the entire population based on the sample data.

title: Why is it Important?
text: Consider why researchers can't always study an entire population. Think about the resources, time, and feasibility involved in studying every individual in a population.

title: Types of Sampling Methods
text: There are various methods to achieve a representative sample. Some common methods include random sampling, stratified sampling, and cluster sampling. Each method has its own advantages and is suitable for different types of studies.
